nodes.bodyText: I would suggest to handle this case separately to output a better error message (e.g. "The execution result is empty.").
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -524,7 +524,7 @@ extractExecutionResults() {
 
     execution_results=$(echo "${output}" | grep ${EXECUTION_PREFIX})
     num_lines=$(echo "${execution_results}" | wc -l)
-    if [[ ${num_lines} -ne ${expected_lines} ]]; then
+    if [[ -z ${execution_results} || ${num_lines} -ne ${expected_lines} ]]; then

nodes.bodyText: yes, the current error message would be misleading since it would claim that there was 1 line.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -524,7 +524,7 @@ extractExecutionResults() {
 
     execution_results=$(echo "${output}" | grep ${EXECUTION_PREFIX})
     num_lines=$(echo "${execution_results}" | wc -l)
-    if [[ ${num_lines} -ne ${expected_lines} ]]; then
+    if [[ -z ${execution_results} || ${num_lines} -ne ${expected_lines} ]]; then
